channel.title: VB Code not functioning properly
channel.description:
First, I'm not saying the VB is a good programming language. I think it's one of the worst languages in the world.
At work, we use macros in our Office products (Word, Excel, etc) and all of the macros are written in VB (no way in doing it in another language). The problem is, most of the usual VB syntax doesn't work. I can't initialize the variable when I declare it.
Instead of [code=VB] Dim Something as Integer = 42 [/code]
I have to do [code=VB] Dim Something as Integer Set Something = 42 [/code]
What would cause things like this to happen? I get a generic compilation error, which tells me nothing. The version is VB6, and the Office products are from 2010.

item.title: VB Code not functioning properly

@slavemaster wrote:

All Visual Basic 6 should work.

item.title: VB Code not functioning properly
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Because, as I stated, most of the usual VB syntax doesn’t work. I can’t identify why exactly, but if I do not use “Set”, I get a Syntax error, preventing compilation.

Read full topic

item.title: VB Code not functioning properly
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Dim Something As Integer
Something = 42

should work.
why are you using ‘Set?’

Read full topic

item.title: VB Code not functioning properly
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

First, I’m not saying the VB is a good programming language. I think it’s one of the worst languages in the world.

At work, we use macros in our Office products (Word, Excel, etc) and all of the macros are written in VB (no way in doing it in another language). The problem is, most of the usual VB syntax doesn’t work. I can’t initialize the variable when I declare it.

Instead of

Dim Something as Integer = 42

I have to do

Dim Something as Integer
Set Something = 42

What would cause things like this to happen? I get a generic compilation error, which tells me nothing. The version is VB6, and the Office products are from 2010.
